metadata.Title: CVE-2017-3589 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Connectors component of Oracle MySQL(subcomponent: Connector/J). Supported versions that are affected are5.1.41 and earlier. Easily "exploitable" vulnerability allows lowprivileged attacker with logon to the infrastructure where MySQL Connectorsexecutes to compromise MySQL Connectors. Successful attacks of thisvulnerability can result in unauthorized update, insert or delete access tosome of MySQL Connectors accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 3.3(Integrity impacts). CVSS Vector:(CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:U/C:N/I:L/A:N).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3589` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysql-java - 5.1.45-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-connector-java package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.1.45-1').
